newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Suharto's son urges Japan to use local car parts.
newsitem.headline: Suharto's son urges Japan to use local car parts.

text.p: President Suharto's youngest son, Hutomo Mandala Putra, has urged Japanese car companies to use more parts made in Indonesia instead of taking the issue of a national car to the World Trade Organisation (WTO).
PT Timor Putra Nasional, controlled by Hutomo, has established a joint venture with South Korea's Kia Motors Corp to produce a "national car" for Indonesia.

"If Japanese firms transferred to full manufacturing in Indonesia or were able to meet a 60 percent local content requirement, then Timor would have thought twice before implementing the national car programme," Hutomo said in a statement made available to Reuters on Wednesday.
"Bringing the Indonesian car policy to the WTO is all talk. Japan should increase the manufacturing process in Indonesia, instead of wasting its time (with the WTO)," he said.
Japan has threatened to take Indonesia to the WTO over its a policy, which lets only Timor Putra import vehicles from Kia in South Korea free of tariffs and imposes luxury taxes on other car makers.
Hutomo said his company was ready to cooperate with Japanese firms on producing car components.
"Timor is ready to cooperate with Japanese firms or other countries. Cooperation between Timor and Kia of South Korea is not exclusive," he said.

The tax breaks were given to Timor Putra in February on the condition that it meet local content requirements within three years. The policy has also been condemned by the United States and the European Union as against WTO rules.
